api_key.description: This is the Redis Cloud API key. It must be provided but can also be set by the `REDISCLOUD_ACCESS_KEY` environment variable.

secret_key.description: This is the Redis Cloud API secret key. It must be provided but can also be set by the `REDISCLOUD_SECRET_KEY` environment variable.

url.description: This is the URL of Redis Cloud and will default to `https://api.redislabs.com/v1`. This can also be set by the `REDISCLOUD_URL` environment variable.

endpoint.description: A Redis URI (sample format: 'redis://user:password@host:port)'. If the URI provided is Redis Cloud instance, only host and port should be provided (using the format: ['redis://endpoint1:6379', 'redis://endpoint2:6380'])

block.description: The Payment Method data source allows access to the ID of a Payment Method configured against your Redis Enterprise Cloud account. This ID can be used when creating Subscription resources.

private_service_connect_service_id.description: The ID of the Private Service Connect Service relative to the associated subscription

subscription_id.description: The ID of a Pro subscription

block.description: The Private Service Connect data source allows access to an available Private Service Connect Service within your Redis Enterprise Cloud Account.

private_service_connect_service_id.description: The ID of the Private Service Connect Service relative to the associated subscription

subscription_id.description: The ID of a Pro subscription

block.description: The Private Service Connect Endpoints data source allows access to an available endpoints on a Private Service Connect Service within your Redis Enterprise Cloud Account.

provider_name.description: The name of the cloud provider to filter returned regions, (accepted values are `AWS` or `GCP`).

regions.description: A list of regions from either a single or multiple cloud providers

block.description: The Regions data source allows access to a list of supported cloud provider regions. These regions can be used with the subscription resource.

maintenance_windows.description: Details about the subscription's maintenance window specification

memory_storage.description: Memory storage preference: either ‘ram’ or a combination of 'ram-and-flash’

name.description: The name of the subscription to filter returned subscriptions

number_of_databases.description: The number of databases that are linked to this subscription

payment_method.description: Payment method for the requested subscription. Either 'credit-card' or 'marketplace'

payment_method_id.description: A valid payment method pre-defined in the current account

pricing.description: Pricing details totalled over this Subscription

block.description: The Pro Subscription data source allows access to the details of an existing pro subscription within your Redis Enterprise Cloud account.

peerings.description: A list of VPC peerings from either a single or multiple cloud providers

status.description: Current status of the account - `initiating-request`, `pending-acceptance`, `active`, `inactive` or `failed`

subscription_id.description: A valid subscription predefined in the current account

block.description: The Subscription Peerings data source allows access to a list of VPC peerings configured on the subscription.

attachment_status.description: The status of the Subscription/Transit Gateway attachment, if any

attachment_uid.description: A unique identifier for the Subscription/Transit Gateway attachment, if any

aws_account_id.description: The Transit Gateway's AWS account id

aws_tgw_uid.description: The id of the Transit Gateway as known to AWS

cidrs.description: A list of consumer Cidr blocks, if an attachment exists

status.description: The status of the Transit Gateway

subscription_id.description: The id of a Pro/Flexible subscription

tgw_id.description: The id of the Transit Gateway relative to the associated subscription

block.description: The Transit Gateway data source allows access to an available Transit Gateway within your Redis Enterprise Cloud Account.
